result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason C. Bolter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay fine of $ 300.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA samle (unless previosuly provided)
**Pay DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason C. Bolter

records.addlTxt:
ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:09am-  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions - consecutive to 09CF1025.  Court orders $300.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:14pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.
Due to time constraints, 7/23/2014 Final pre-trial is moved from 10:30am to 2pm.
Final pre-trial on July 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Watson is requesting 6/18/2014 Final pre-trial be rescheduled - DE was not writted.  Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 7/23/2014 at 10:30am.  NTBS by the Court.
File to Br 6 for subst
